title: Daily Café Lunch
summary: Free community lunch — relaxed, welcoming, and open to all
description: Join us for a free community lunch between 12–2 pm — relaxed, welcoming, and open to all Neuro Resilience participants.

title: Tasty Tuesdays
summary: Free three-course meal cooked by volunteers
description: Enjoy a free three-course meal cooked by volunteers — a friendly evening to meet friends and make new ones.

title: Opportunity Hub Drop-In
summary: Drop in for chat, advice, or social time
description: Drop in for a chat with staff, access advice, or simply enjoy social time in a safe, supportive environment.

title: Skills Builder One-to-One Coaching
summary: Personal coaching for workplace and life skills
description: Personal coaching using the Skills Builder framework — helping you develop essential workplace and life skills at your own pace.

title: Skills Builder Small Group Workshop
summary: Interactive sessions on teamwork and communication
description: Interactive sessions exploring teamwork, problem-solving, and communication using the Skills Builder model.

title: Building Futures Employability Support
summary: Move toward employment, education, or training
description: One-to-one support and vocational workshops to help you move toward employment, education, or training.

title: Neuro Resilience Bedrock Program
summary: Six-month pilot developing self-awareness and readiness
description: Six-month pilot supporting neurodivergent offenders to develop self-awareness, emotional regulation, and readiness for work.

title: Youth Counselling (Stop Breathe Think)
description: Free, confidential youth counselling provided by Stop Breathe Think for young people needing emotional support.

title: Do-It Neurodiversity Profiler
summary: Personal profiling tool for understanding strengths
description: Personal profiling tool to help understand your strengths and needs, informing personalised support planning.

title: Open Mic Night
description: Monthly open-mic event featuring local talent — free food, refreshments, and a supportive creative atmosphere.
schedule: First Friday of each month, 6:30 PM onwards

title: Live Gig Nights
summary: Monthly gig showcasing bands and musicians
description: Monthly gig night showcasing bands, musicians, and performers — community vibe with great food and music.
schedule: Third Friday of each month, 7:00 PM onwards

title: Peer Support Forum
description: Join others with lived experience to share stories, ideas, and peer-led solutions shaping the future of Neuro Resilience.

title: Co-Design Workshop: Shaping New Support Models
summary: Co-design new approaches for community support
description: Interactive session where participants help co-design new approaches for community and employment support.

title: Youth Drop-In
summary: Safe space for young people to socialise
description: Safe, supportive space for young people to socialise, build confidence, and explore creative or skills-based activities.

title: Young Voices Forum
description: A youth-led space where participants share ideas, influence Neuro Resilience programmes, and plan community projects.
